												Look at this as a simulator and you'll be let down. Looking at this as a truck-themed arcade game, and you'll praise:• An amazing map - no prefabricated undersized intersections. The bespoke highways are properly scaled and a joy to drive on. You can do more than 30mph without tipping over. The map itself is huge - takes several hours to cross despite higher speeds and straighter roads than ETS• You can see your hired drivers on the road as they work, and join them in competitive jobs• A far, far, far more detailed truck diagnostics system than other games. Worn brake pads grind against the discs and degrade braking performance. Panels get beat up, the engine runs like crap.• The truck upgrade system is excellent and features things like side and rear mounted cameras to cover blind spots.• Cops (could be a con for some!)• Nice side-missions, help out hitchhikers if you want, pick up extra jobs from cafés or over the radioThat isn't to say this game is without flaws. The iffy handling and dodgy physics are geared to racing, not driving. There are competitive jobs where you are pitted against other drivers to race cargo to its destination (very unrealistic). There are also truck races and out-of-this-world missions to complete, too.In summary, don't look at it as a sim and you will be able to forgive its shortcomings. Go for a race or forgive the iffy handling and go for a really scenic drive.

												Awesome game!! It exceeded my expectations at all levels save one; the graphics performance is underwhelming. It's running at sub 60fps, not at minimum settings but even at minimum doesn't seem improve the frame rate. OK aside from performance issues, i have not encountered big bugs except in the initial stages after i had done a lot of tweakings. It randomly crashed twice while i was driving. Maybe it was due to too many changes and clicking the apply button. All is well now but with a slightly low performance as mentioned before.So what's so good about this game? Well it's more than a truck ♥♥♥ business sim; it's also has a story.Lets go over the features.1) As a truck sim there are;a) Headlightsb) Signal lightsc) Wipersd) Parking brakee) Engine brakef) Truck equipment / component upgradesg) repairs & maintenance costsh) fuel requirementi) hazard lightsj) hornk) and of course, buying more trucks and upgrading your own truck (like in Hard Truck 2)2) As a business sim there are;a) Hire & fire driversb) buying more trucksc) monitoring schedulesd) managing cash flowe) expanding business reach by adding offices in other townsf) competing with other companies (like in Hard Truck 2)3) As a story;a) a personal log of encounters along the wayb) cutscenes of your journey aka storyc) detailed animated charactersd) excellent voice actingSo what about the environment? Well it's good enough at low settings so it should be pretty impressive if maxed out. The road curves and hills are smooth, no jarring crude polygons as it once were in Hard Truck 2. No road mines either so that's a relief! Day and night cycles and weather cycles. The roads and highways, they are expansive and very impressive, at least to me. While driving from town to town there's plenty to see of the environment though some might disagree.And driving physics? Seems very good, you can see the motion of the suspension on the individual wheels. Keyboard sensitivity can be adjusted from fast to slow. So does the centering rate. These 2 settings are very useful in finding the right balance to suit individual driving preference.What about graphics and sound quality? All great! Trucks look detailed both in and out. Reflection details and rate of update can be adjusted many levels. Shadow details and viewing distance can also be adjusted many levels. Same with HDR and truck detail levels. In short all adjustable settings are graduated from 1 to 10 steps. Some settings only have on or off. It should be quite easy to find the right balance of quality and performance for any machine that meets the system requirements. Engine whirr and growl sounds real IMO. Radio stations play a wide selection of quality music. You can even add your own station like in Test Drive Unlimited.  Radio is one aspect where Rig 'n' Roll shine. You can hear up to 3 people talking in between music at random and they are rather funny & witty. What is even more amazing is the fact that the talking voices even interrupts your radio station.Final aspect, nearly neglected to mention is the brilliant AI which ties the whole game together and is nothing short of amazing. Where in most other driving or racing games, the traffic or NPC AI is either dumb or gets in the way or pops in & out of existence at random just to block your path; in this game that rarely happens, even when you're racing with other AI truckers. AI traffic & other AI truckers not participating in the same cargo run, would never get in your way unless overtaking another AI traffic which is in-front of them. Even when your're driving against the flow, the AI traffic & other AI trucks cleverly avoid head-on collision. AI seems to extend even to the radio interruptions. For example; they might talk about the need to upgrade engine when your diving rather slowly in a race. The talking voices isn't there just to lend a live effect to the stations they also talk about random events that are happening in the game. Some messages given by the radio appears in your journal as clickable entries which may include random quests. Therefore turning on the radio becomes a necessity if you want to participate in the random events.Cops are very aggressive and tenacious. It's almost impossible to lose them. If you go to a warehouse, they will follow you in or be waiting outside and continue the chase when you leave. If you refuse to stop, more cops will chase you and try to run you off the road. The resulting fines and damages to your rig can negate all rewards for the delivery or race run. So it's usually best to stop & pay-up at the first sign of a siren. Though it's possible to lose them, should they catch you later the previous fines are added to the current one. Also any accidents involving AI vehicles is deemed your fault no matter what; the cops are on a mission to give you a hard time. Never cross a yellow line in front of a cop or they will chase you to hell and back! Despite all the problems the cops can dish out, there's a neat feature called save game which can be made at any time while driving so you can immediately undo that horrible crash or wong turn you just made. ;)Game world is huge, beautiful and detailed. The lighting and reflection effects on the road when it drizzles and vehicle surfaces are impressive. It's best to look around while driving to appreciate the game world but accurate and dexterous finger work is a must to avoid crashing into objects while not looking where you are going and controlling the camera views simultaneously. This game is a big improvement over Hard Truck 2 in all aspects. Glad i bought it despite the 'Mostly Negative' rating at the time of this writing. Lastly you don't need a wheel to drive well in this game; it works just fine with a keyboard. But you'll need a high-end rig to get the most out of it. Don't miss this underrated gem; try it for yourself. I absolutely love it! 4/5 stars.http://games.dailymotion.com/video/x2j2s6g?utm_source=dailymotion&utm_medium=autopromo&utm_campaign=fromplayertogames
